hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via ETH/BTC Strength Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: During a prolonged NEUTRAL regime for BTC (>10 days), a decisive breakout in the ETH/BTC ratio above its own 30-day high, confirmed by high relative volume, leads a regime transition to BULL for the aggregate crypto market within 5 days, with ETH leading the rally.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In crypto, 'altcoin seasons' often begin with ETH outperforming BTC, signaling a risk-on rotation and broadening of market participation beyond the dominant asset. This rotation provides the fuel to break the broader market out of a neutral, consolidated state. The condition requires the move to be ETH-led (high volume) to filter out false BTC-driven ratio moves.
entry_conditions: BTC regime == NEUTRAL for > 10 consecutive days
ETH/BTC ratio makes a daily close above its 30-day high
Volume on the ETH/USD pair on breakout day is > 1.8x its 20-day average (signifying ETH-specific demand)
The breakout candle closes in the top 25% of its daily range (strong conviction)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Aggregate regime model shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio closes back below its 20-day moving average
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days after entry if regime has not shifted to BULL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH/BTC breakouts meeting these conditions fail to catalyze a broader BULL regime shift within 5 days in over 50% of cases, remaining in NEUTRAL or reverting to BEAR.
